articles.title: What is home care?
articles.preview_text: Many people needing health care services prefer to stay close to family and friends in a familiar and comfortable environment, rather than moving into an assisted living or long-term care home.

articles.title: Home care teams
articles.preview_text: Home care is often provided by a team of health care providers. Each health care provider has unique skills, knowledge, roles, and responsibilities, working together to provide comprehensive care.

articles.title: My Home Care Team
articles.preview_text: The “My Home Care Team” tool is a printable sheet that helps with understanding and keeping track of the health care providers that make up a home care team.

articles.title: Adapting to New or Changing Care Staff
articles.preview_text: There may be times when care expectations are unmet. Learn about common home care challenges that might be encountered and tools and strategies for dealing with them.

articles.title: What is a Caregiver?
articles.preview_text: A caregiver is someone who provides unpaid care to another person. Across Canada, one in four people provide unpaid care to a family member or friend. Caregivers save the healthcare system between $24-31 billion annually.

articles.title: Caregiver Stress & Burnout
articles.preview_text: The responsibilities caregivers have may increase their likelihood of experiencing stress and burnout. It is important for caregivers to understand warning signs and use coping strategies when they feel stressed or burnt out.

articles.title: Stress & Burnout Self-Assessment
articles.preview_text: The Stress and Burnout Self-Assessment helps caregivers determine their level of burnout and stress. This tool should only be used as a guideline and does not replace the advice of health care professionals.

articles.title: Caregiver Health
articles.preview_text: Caregiving can feel overwhelming some days. It's easy to put personal needs aside in order to get through a to-do list, but caring for yourself is one of the best things you can do for the person you care for.
